<div class="pilwrap" id="intro">
  <h2>
    <a href="#intro" name="intro" class="pilcrow"></a>
Intro
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Prettier is an opinionated code formatter. It enforces a consistent style by parsing your code and re-printing it with its own rules that take the maximum line length into account, wrapping code when necessary.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="input">
  <h3>
    <a href="#input" name="input" class="pilcrow"></a>
Input
  </h3>
</div>
<!-- prettier-ignore -->
<pre><code class="js">foo(reallyLongArg(), omgSoManyParameters(), IShouldRefactorThis(), isThereSeriouslyAnotherOne());
</code></pre>
<div class="pilwrap" id="output">
  <h3>
    <a href="#output" name="output" class="pilcrow"></a>
Output
  </h3>
</div>
<pre><code class="js">foo(
  reallyLongArg(),
  omgSoManyParameters(),
  IShouldRefactorThis(),
  isThereSeriouslyAnotherOne(),
);
</code></pre>
<p>Prettier can be run <a href="https://prettier.io/docs/editors">in your editor</a> on-save, in a <a href="https://prettier.io/docs/precommit">pre-commit hook</a>, or in <a href="https://prettier.io/docs/cli#list-different">CI environments</a> to ensure your codebase has a consistent style without devs ever having to post a nit-picky comment on a code review ever again!</p>
<hr>
